data.meanings: to swing, halt in a place, move, toss. Mankind, people, others, men.
data.sentence: The word النَّاسِ comes from the root ن و س and is associated with the meanings: to swing, halt in a place, move, toss. Mankind, people, others, men.

data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word يَعْلَمُونَ comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.

data.meanings: to swing, halt in a place, move, toss. Mankind, people, others, men.
data.sentence: The word لِلنَّاسِ comes from the root ن و س and is associated with the meanings: to swing, halt in a place, move, toss. Mankind, people, others, men.

data.meanings: But (after a negation); but not (after an affirmation).
data.sentence: The word وَلَكِنَّ comes from the root ل ك ن and is associated with the meanings: But (after a negation); but not (after an affirmation).

data.meanings: to send a messenger, bestow, let go. rasul (pl. rusul) - envoy, bearer of a message, messenger. risalat - message, commission, mission, epistle. arsala (vb. 4) - to send. mursalat (pl. of mursalatun) - those sent forth.
data.sentence: The word أَرْسَلْنَاكَ comes from the root ر س ل and is associated with the meanings: to send a messenger, bestow, let go. rasul (pl. rusul) - envoy, bearer of a message, messenger. risalat - message, commission, mission, epistle. arsala (vb. 4) - to send. mursalat (pl. of mursalatun) - those sent forth.

data.sentence: The word بَشِيرًا comes from the root ب ش ر and is associated with the meanings: Skin/Pare/Strip/Skin Contact/Epidermis (or insides)Complexion/Hue->Delicacy, fineness ofBeauty/Elegance of form/Bright cheerful countenanceRejoiced/Rejoicing/Good, good tidings, glad tidings/Announcements (bearer of), proclaiming, commencement, beginnings of anything/Indications/Streaks (daylight breaking, wind over land)Conducting, managing affairs personally.Lie with, to go in unto.Mankind, Human beings, Lowest/basest/meanest sort of people, Perfect man (combining gentleness with strength).

data.meanings: (Nun-Thal-Ra) to dedicate, make a vow, warn, admonish, caution, promise voluntarily, offer present. nadhiir - warner, one who informs and averts calamity, who cautions and put one on guard.
data.sentence: The word وَنَذِيرًا comes from the root ن ذ ر and is associated with the meanings: (Nun-Thal-Ra) to dedicate, make a vow, warn, admonish, caution, promise voluntarily, offer present. nadhiir - warner, one who informs and averts calamity, who cautions and put one on guard.

data.meanings: To withhold, desist, refrain from, withdraw, keep back, hold out the hand.
data.sentence: The word كَافَّةً comes from the root ك ف ف and is associated with the meanings: To withhold, desist, refrain from, withdraw, keep back, hold out the hand.

data.meanings: To surpass in number or quantity, increase, multiply, happen often; To be much, many, numerous.
data.sentence: The word أَكْثَرَ comes from the root ك ث ر and is associated with the meanings: To surpass in number or quantity, increase, multiply, happen often; To be much, many, numerous.
